IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PRODUCE OUTSTANDING OPERA TRUE TO THE VISION OF THE COMPOSER, TO ENTERTAIN, ENRICH, AND EDUCATE THE COMMUNITIES IN SOUTHWEST FLORIDA AS WELL AS PATRONS FROM ACROSS THE STATE AND AROUND THE WORLD.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PRODUCE OUTSTANDING OPERA TRUE TO THE VISION OF THE COMPOSER, TO ENTERTAIN, ENRICH, AND EDUCATE THE COMMUNITIES IN SOUTHWEST FLORIDA AS WELL AS PATRONS FROM ACROSS THE STATE AND AROUND THE WORLD. TO PRODUCE SUCH OPERAS; AND TO FOSTER, PROMOTE, AND INCREASE PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE AND APPRECIATION OF OPERA AND SIMILAR PRESENTATIONS; TO INSTRUCT, TRAIN AND EDUCATE BOTH STUDENTS AND THE PUBLIC, GENERALLY, IN OPERA, MUSIC, AND RELATED PREFORMING ARTS; AND TO RENT, ACQUIRE FOR USE, OR OWN, MAINTAIN, AND OPERATE A PLACE OR PLACES TO ACCOMPLISH THESE OBJECTIVES.
IRS990.Desc: SARASOTA OPERA CONTINUED ITS POST-COVID JOURNEY TOWARD A NORMAL OPERATING SCHEDULE. IN THE FALL OF 2022, AUDIENCES REMAINED HESITANT TO RETURN TO LIVE THEATER PERFORMANCES AND HURRICANE IAN ALSO IMPACTED ATTENDANCE. ONCE THE CALENDAR TURNED TO 2023, TICKET SALES INCREASED SIGNIFICANTLY, EXCEEDING BUDGETED SALES FOR TWO OF THE FOUR OPERAS PRESENTED. THE OPERA PRESENTED 34 MAIN STAGE OPERA PERFORMANCES AS WELL AS 4 CONCERTS AND 8 HD MOVIE SHOWINGS. THE OPERA'S YOUTH OPERA PROGRAM RETURNED WITH 2 PERFORMANCES IN THE FALL OF 2022, ALONG WITH COMMUNITY OUTREACH EVENTS, IN-SCHOOL PERFORMANCES AND TEACHER WORKSHOPS. THE OPERA'S TWO GUILD ORGANIZATIONS ALSO RETURNED TO FUNDRAISING EVENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO PROVIDE A STABLE FLOW OF RESOURCES FOR CURRENT OPERATIONS.

THE OPERA QUALIFIES AS A CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION AS DEFINED BY INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3) AND, ACCORDINGLY IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(A). HOWEVER, THE OPERA IS SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX ON UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. FOR THE YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2023, THE OPERA INCURRED NO INCOME TAX EXPENSE. IT IS THE OPERA'S POLICY TO ACCOUNT FOR ANY UNCERTAINTIES IN INCOME TAX LAW IN ACCORDANCE WITH FASB ASC 740-10 ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES. ASC 740-10 CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAIN INCOME TAX POSITIONS AND REQUIRES THAT THE OPERA RECOGNIZE THE IMPACT OF SUCH A TAX POSITION IN ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IF, UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT, THAT POSITION IS MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT TO BE SUSTAINED. MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THE OPERA'S TAX POSITIONS AND CONCLUDED THAT THE OPERA HAS MAINTAINED ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS AND HAS TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. AS A RESULT, NO PROVISION OR LIABILITY FOR INCOME TAXES HAS BEEN INCLUDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE OPERA FILES A 990 RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A FULL COPY OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE FOR THEIR REVIEW AND COMMENT. SUBSEQUENTLY, A FULL COPY OF FORM 990 IS THEN PROVIDED TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD, PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES ALL POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST TO BE REPORTED TO A SUPERVISOR AND/OR TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES CONFLICTS OF INTEREST TO BE AVOIDED OTHER THAN TO THE EXTENT THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR HAS PROVIDED THE EMPLOYEE WITH A WRITTEN EXEMPTION. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ARE ASKED TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AT THEIR ANNUAL MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION ENGAGES A HUMAN RESOURCE COMMITTEE WHICH FUNCTIONS AS A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE WHICH REVIEWS INDUSTRY COMPENSATION SURVEYS, REVIEWS AND APPROVES OPERA'S ANNUAL BUDGET AND REQUIRES RATIFICATION BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR ARTISTIC AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTORS. ARTISTIC AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTORS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL OTHER PAID EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST OR AT WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG, WWW.CHARITYNAVIGATOR.ORG, AND WWW.THEGIVINGPARTNER.ORG.
THE PROCESS IS UNCHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
